credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
title: Design for the West Wall of the Entrance Hall, Royal Pavilion at Brighton
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and watercolor, traces of graphite on white wove paper
description:
Elevation of a wall, with a central niche containing a porcelain pagoda mounted on a pedestal. This is flanked with two niches containing Chinese figures in costume. Tablets with Chinese characters on piers between niches. A balcony with trelliswork design above.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory.
name: Drawing
